result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Troy H. PIONTEK was found guilty of OWI (7th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after having served the first year of initial confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Under go alcohol assessment including the Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Pay attorney fees - to be reimbursed to Manitowoc County.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless he is legally licensed.
Maintain fulltime employment or work search.

Petition and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees signed by JLF on 04-20-2015.
Voucher 15-047, in the amount of $485.00,sent to the Manitowoc County Comptroller on 04-21-2015.
Copies of Petition and Order mailed to defendant and counsel on 04-21-2015.

Transcript of plea and sentencing hearing held on 02-04-15.
Copy of transcript delivered to Registrar along with defendant.

The parties stipulate to a BAC of .199 at the time of driving.
GUILTY plea entered to count 1, OWI -7th offense.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, prohibited BAC.  Motion granted.
The defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total of five (5) years.  That is three (3) years initial confinement followed by two (2) years extended supervision.
The Court finds the defendant not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after the first year of initial confinement has been served.
Conditions of extended supervision:
1) Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless he is legally licensed;
2) Maintain absolute sobriety;
3) Undergo alcohol assessment including the Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan;
4) Pay a $1,600.00 fine ($800 X 2) plus costs, total of $3,035.00.  $1,000.00 cash bail applied.
5) Maintain fulltime employment or work search;
6) pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC;
7) pay attorney fees  to be reimbursed to Manitowoc County;
8) provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
In addition, the Court orders a thirty-six (36) month DL revocation and period of Ignition Interlock.

Initial Appearance reset to 06-23-14 at 2:30 p.m.

Amended Court Findings and Order.  
The Court hereby orders, that the defendant's Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order which had previously been denied is now granted because the court finds the person is currently indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Eric Pangburn as counsel of record.

Defendant explains that he does not have money to get an attorney and shows the Court how many attorneys have declined based on his lack of funds.  Court will review his application again.  Initial appearance reset to 06-23-14 at 9:30 a.m.  
Minutes

Petition for Appointment of Counsel;  Affidavit of Indigency and Order.
The Petition for Appointment of Counsel is denied.  The defendant is not indigent.
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 06-16-14 at 9:30 a.m.

RE:  OWI - 7th offense, on 05-23-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of OWI - 7th offense.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-02-14 at 9:30 a.m. Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he maintain absolute sobriety and that he not operate a motor vehicle.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
